Michael, address this maybe. Astronomers propose that the universe has existed for a little more than 13.8 billion years. There are close to 7.8 billion people living on earth, If you count every individuals experience of time seperately, 7.8 billion seconds a second experienced collectively. That's 130 million minutes per second, around 2.17 million hours per second, around 90.3 thousand days per second, 247 years per second. In 2 years, humanity as a whole experiences more time than scientists propose has elapsed since the inception of the universe. Around 15.6 billion years in two years.
